image_analysis.description: A scanned image displaying four pages (85, 86, 87, 88) of a deposition transcript. The pages are arranged in a two-by-two grid. Each page has a two-column layout with timestamps and line numbers for the transcribed text.
image_analysis.layout: The image shows four distinct pages from a larger document, labeled 85, 86, 87, and 88. Each page is formatted as a standard legal transcript with line numbers, timestamps, and the transcribed dialogue. A header indicates the page number, and a footer contains deposition service information, dates, and document control numbers.

01:35:36   4   agreement that said, this agreement will prevent federal
01:35:40   5   prosecution for international and interstate sex
01:35:43   6   trafficking, not only of Jeffrey Epstein, and not only

01:35:53   9   close quote.
01:35:55  10           And so that was unusual because what it --
01:35:57  11   what it seemed to be doing was that somehow this
01:35:58  12   agreement was quite out of the normal and had been
01:36:00  13   designed to extend immunity to other people that might
01:36:04  14   have been associated with Epstein.
01:36:05  15           And I knew that that category included the
01:36:09  16   people that were involved in negotiating this highly
01:36:11  17   unusual provision included Mr. Dershowitz, who had been
01:36:14  18   heavily involved, not only in the drafting of the
01:36:18  19   agreement, but had also been involved remarkably in
01:36:20  20   attacking the credibility of these girls and saying
01:36:22  21   things like, you know, it was -- Epstein wasn't
01:36:25  22   targeting minor girls, which just struck -- you know, I
01:36:28  23   was -- I don't want to use a technical term,
01:36:33  24   gob-smacked, that a defense attorney with an obligation
01:36:35  25   to tell the truth was making a factual representation

document_metadata.subject: Deposition concerning Jeffrey Epstein, a nonprosecution agreement, and the alleged involvement of Mr. Dershowitz and others.

notes: The document is a transcript of a deposition. The text is clear and legible. The content discusses sensitive topics related to a criminal investigation.
